content: You can try exporting the old Thunderbird profile and importing it to the new Thunderbird profile. I don't know if it overwrites existing data or not so I would make a backup of both profiles before proceeding. These articles may help you: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-export https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-import

content:
Hello there


Network error Browser related / Google.

Send me a screenshot from the issue , pop up s.



Your error 400 entry is a browser related message for you.

your header may be too long to be filled in and caches on your computer may contain outdated files, which can be emptied as well as for the Thunderbird software.

Too much data can also be present in all kinds of places outside the Thunderbird software.

please try to solve this first. Suspend and reinstall your Google account.

That is, use short headers for transmission, there is a limit to it.

clean your computer of the cookies it contains.

Avoid big attachments at the moment.

For Further question s you can report me back here with no problem.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/compacting-folders-potential-complicationshttps://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/compacting-folders


Furthermore, I can suggest that you completely clear your browser history and your browser cache.

Also in progress to remove work around this period.

This is outside your Thunderbird software problems.


Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: googlethunderbird

content:
Some like threading, many don't. I have providered here the info to disable and also the info to prevent in any future installation for you:


This is the official (to my knowledge) documentation. Well worth the read https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird

Here is my own documentation on threading, duplicating the above, but it may help: You need to highlight each folder and click View>sort by>unthreaded. If this applies to just a few folders, just repeat the process as necessary. If you have many folders or plan to add many new folders, you may wish a different approach, below:

More info: To change default for *new* folders, In config editor, you can change default that applies to NEW folders you set up: mailnews.default_view_flags 0=unthreaded

Config editor is available at Tools>settings>general and scroll to bottom right. 

 ------------

To set many *existing* folders, follow these steps: (I creates a crude video that walks through the steps. The video was created with table view for the message list pane. 

   https://davidkirk.org/SettingDefaultFolderView.mp4  that demonstrates the following steps: 
   First, highlight a folder that you have set to unthreaded	    In the Message List view, in the column header, on the far right, open the options button that shows         context menu. :    At the very bottom is the option:    -> "Apply current view to..."    -> "Folder and its children..."    -> Hover over an account    -> In the next menu don't select a folder. Instead select the account name itself.  ALSO, for future installations of Thunderbird,  - create a simple text file with name of user.js with these lines:       // Set default threading to UNthreaded  ###   <== this line is optional, just for documentation      user_pref("mailnews.default_view_flags", 0); - install Thunderbird and exit prior to setting up accounts - copy the user.js file into the profile - now, when you start Thunderbird, unthreading will be the default. Problem solved.
creator: davidsk

content: The solution you mentioned works for many folders as well as few folders. The menu structure is a bit delicate, but it should work fine for your 300+ folders. The same basic keystrokes to apply unthreaded to all folders will do the same for column alignment.
creator: davidsk

content:
Heike Schmidt said
Nothing works any more. Ans I need help in German. Incoming mail server is already in use.., enter your access data via Imap gmail com - but this does not work. Set up existing account again - does not work. Log in via google - does not work Error message 400. Now I've been to a computer store - they also tried everything for 30 minutes - no success and have now unfortunately deleted my gmail account including all folders... So I'm really at a loss. Who can help me? Thanks a lot Heike

Make sure cookies are accepted in TB Settings/Privacy & Security, that the authentication method is OAuth2 for the incoming and outgoing servers, and remove your antivirus temporarily if it's not MS Security, i.e. something like AVG/Avast.

There's a German forum at https://www.thunderbird-mail.de/home/
creator: sfhowes
